comment.text:
My son and daughter and I shared an amazing 5 course meal that was like nothing you can find anywhere else. Our Server Amy was sweet,  attentive and prompt. Our 
water glasses were always full. The blueberry foie gras was delightfully sweet and light and the salmon dip had chunks of salmon with  a delicate flavor. I'm so happy my daughter wanted to try the Amber Kaluga Caviar Service delivered to us my the very pleasant GM Victoria. It was well worth the price. The tataki was wonderful on the toasted baguette. The bolognese and gnocchi were perfect. And dessert was heavenly. The atmosphere is upscale casual. All our food is pictured below. The Woodall offers a unique quality experience.

photos.caption: White Chocolate Panna Cotta with crispy yoghurt and Bailey's Butter Cake
Amber Kaluga caviar and beef tataki

comment.text:
Giving three stars as the food was pretty good! Knocking this mainly for service issues. We came for brunch per the recommendation of some friends and were so disappointed:(

There were maybe 5 customers total while we were there, but our server still some how managed to neglect our table. She asked if we needed fresh silverware after our appetizers, never brought any- our food was getting cold so we had to steal some from the table nearby. I never got a refill on my drink and didn't have anything more than half my meal. My husband wanted another cocktail but she just never came back. You pay a premium for service and we just didn't see it. 

Unfortunately the bad out weighed the good here and we aren't sure we will return.

photos.caption: Calamari - its odd that in all the photos I see online the salsa is on the side?
One of two apps we ordered - in my opinion better than the entree

comment.text: I will forever sing the praises of the Woodall! A gem on the upper west side the food is good, the service is phenomenal and whether you have brunch, lunch or dinner, no choice here is a bad choice. The bartenders know just the right balance as well!
Can't wait to come back. Been twice for brunch and have plans to try dinner. Chicken biscuit is

Drove by this restaurant almost a year ago and put it on my mental list of places to try.  Located in the relatively new Westside Village Center, it's convenient to both OTP and ITP clients.  Swankier than you'd expect from the outside with a new American menu.  Cocktails were well prepared and service was solid.  This would be a great place for a first date.  It's quite and the booths are cozy and private, perfect for a lingering conversation.  Great wine list, especially by the glass.

I live close to the Woodall and always hope establishments near me succeed.Hopefully a bit of  criticism helps and doesn't offend.
I have been 3 times since the opening. The staff is always friendly and I really like the atmosphere. 
I have to say the food is just ok, good but nothing special. Today was for brunch, had biscuits and gravy.  Serving one white biscuit with white gravy on a white plate without even a side of fruit is underwhelming. 
I will say that in a pinch we will still visit the Woodall.

We always kinda forget about this gem ! But each and every visit has been excellent. Servers are always personable , the food is always 5 star quality plated with consideration and artistry. Flavorful and seasoned to help the natural
Taste of the meal shine through.

This place is around the corner from my apartment and I've been there a few times for drinks and light appetizers. From what I've experienced I would say the food is pretty good and the drinks are tasty and an acceptable amount of alcohol. The ambience is also really nice, you have the option of sitting outside in their covered space or in the hall between the two buildings. I've only interacted with the bar staff for the most part and they are always friendly, nice and attentive. I will continue to visit and try different items on the menu and hopefully dive a little deeper.

My favorite go to place for ambiance and food and a nice selection of wine and rotating chef specials. My go to appetizer is the Charred okra and it is so tasty and a generous serving I've eaten just that and a salad. Another great one is the Brussels sprouts. I will say the crab gnocchi can be a hit or miss with portions as I've ordered and fantastic and other times like literally barely a tablespoon of crab. The crab fried rice is great and so are a bunch of the other meals too much to name. I've never had a disappointing food experience there.

I've been here a few times for dinner and never got around to post. Came for light snacks and cocktails after work one day. Service was very attentive, carpaccio app was absolutely delicious! Also my cocktail was very good. Also prices are very reasonable for Atlanta and ambience very nice. Will definitely be back

photos.caption: Cocktail, can't quite remember which one

comment.text:
A true gem of a chef! I had the steak frites with added seared foie gras and the meat quality here is absolute top notch! Both melted in my mouth and the fries easily qualified as the best fries I've had in 2021...or longer! The secret is the beef tallow, a technique also used by McDonald's in the earlier days! The creme brulee made with vanilla from Madagascar hit the spot. All just delightful!

Of note, I have never before seen a restaurant with a true 4.5 star rating on Yelp. Every other one I ever came across was disappointing and I'm sure the rating was inflated by fake reviews. In my opinion, this one is a very rare exception!

photos.caption: Steak frites with added seared foie gras and the best fries in Atlanta! Delightful!

owner_replies.comment: M R, ~ Thank you for your 5 star review and your kind words.  I will pass it along to our team at the Woodall. We look forward to serving you again soon. Happy Holidays.

comment.text:
Ugh, not impressed by brunch...
I had the shrimp and scallops with smoked polenta.  Although the flavor of the polenta was good, it did not make up for the truly measly portion.To use shrimp and scallops in plural is quite generous - two shrimp and 2 tiny bay scallops.  Bear in mind that 6 jumbo shrimp is estimated as a 3 oz portion - and these were not jumbo.  
I cannot remember the last time I polished off my plate AND left hungry, but here I was ~$30 later and wondering what I could eat to supplement my meal.  Others at my table had similar experiences with the pulled pork hash and chicken salad.  My cocktail was just fine.

Service was generally okay, but nothing exemplary.  The restaurant was about half full; ordering felt rushed but service afterward was sparse.

I have dined here in the evening once before - right when they first opened.  I remember service being better, and granted I had the burger, but it was fairly filling.  I'm not sure if the place has declined (already!) or if dinner is more of their strength.  IF I do return, it will surely not be to order any of the items we experienced this time.

I've been here 3 times in total a different bartender each time. Every time I've sat at the bar I'm usually ignored i have to flag down the bartender multiple times while other people not of color are served and tended to very graciously. I thought the first time maybe the bartender was just having a bad day. But every time I come to this establishment I'm never checked on , barely greeted, treated like an inconvenience when attempting to just place an order. I'm very nice every time I'm at the bar so it really sucks that the bar across from my house I'm always treated so poorly. I don't want to say it's a race thing but from all 3 of my experiences I feel very much like i'm not wanted at this establishment. But food and drinks are always pretty good.

We enjoyed our visit here. I made reservations on Open Table for a Thursday but the restaurant wasn't too busy, besides the patio.

The interior is nice and would make for a great date night spot but bring a sweater - it's very cold inside!

For drinks I tried What's in Fashion and a Manhattan. Both drinks were pretty good but my Manhattan took literally 3 tries, the server kept coming back saying they don't have the rye I requested. I don't care, just make it with whatever rye you got at that point!

They had a couple of nightly specials and my bf and I got the same thing - steak, shrimp, and scallop dish served over "risotto" and sautéed veggies. The seafood portion was pretty good but the steak was a bit tough and undercooked for Med-Rare, more like rare. Nevertheless, the service was great and we enjoyed the experience.

Overall: plenty of parking, patio, full bar, nice atmosphere (but chilly inside), great service.

photos.caption: Nightly special- steak, shrimp, scallops over risotto

owner_replies.comment:
Ksenia,

Thank you for taking the time to write us a review about your visit. It is greatly appreciated and we will share your feedback with the team. We look forward to having you back.

comment.text: Absolutely Great Dinner Every Time!  Ever since the new Chef took over, we have been back four times and dinner is Great! The current Bar tender is also legit. We always get the carpaccio (best one ever had) and pastas and change the entrees. My husband loves the beet salad.

photos.caption: NY steak we dig in before taking pictures
Lobster Risotto and Cacio y Pepe
OMG!!!! Carpaccio OMG!!! I literally Praise the Lord when I ate this dish!

comment.text:
The Woodall characterizes its atmosphere as "sophisticated southern luxury." I suppose that's reasonable, though I think that they should emphasize the unique nature of their food offerings. It certainly has a strong southern tilt, but it also incorporates a number of Middle Eastern elements throughout various items on the menu.

To start: Look at the hummus. It's a white bean hummus (not chickpea) and also has some harissa/cauliflower to go alongside the laffa. This is not an option I see at southern restaurants, and I don't believe I've seen this exact combination at many Mediterranean restaurants either. I definitely liked it, though I'm admittedly not a huge hummus fan anyway.

Separately: We had two egg dishes. One was a daily special frittata (including an excellent and colorful set of green/purple leaves with citrus...something they coyly describe as "crisp cool salad.") Another was the shakshuka, wherein we appreciated the breadth of spices and eggplant embedded within the dish. One point to note: In this shakshuka, the eggs are not integrated into the tomato stew. Rather, it is essentially a frittata that is sitting on top of the stew. I had not seen it presented like this before, but I think the advantage is that it enables you to pick the proportions (egg:stew) to your liking...and/or to share specified components of the dish with other diners at the table.

Coming back to the atmosphere: The "outside" area is essentially enclosed with a clear tent and has sufficient heating, even in cold weather. If, however, you feel like you're sitting in a sauna, you can have someone open up a vinyl window panel to experience some fresh air.

The management team should really consider putting prices on their website menu (I never understand why they're willing to show the available dishes but then obfuscate the prices). Regardless, I'm a fan of this spot and would happily return. I get the sense that its location (Westside Village) has subtly kept it off the yuppie radar for those in Midtown/Buckhead, but I'm willing to bet that it becomes much more high profile over time.

Not impressed by brunch at all.

The waitress was nice and I was able to order the crab beignets which isn't in the brunch menu.  They are good but compared to Nola beignets they wouldn't stand up.   

We ordered the burger, fries and salad.

The salad was good the burger was subpar given the price.  

Wouldn't come back for brunch.

First time here for brunch at 1.15pm. They close at 2pm for siesta before opening up for dinner again. The restaurant at this time was lean, very few happy customers enjoying their Saturday.

I was seated very quickly and a server came with menu, ice water, napkins and flatware. I ordered coffee, give me her recommendations which I appreciated. Soon she brought a big cup of coffee, perfect temperature. I don't like my coffee too hot.

I ordered the calamari and a side of fries. I usually finish all my food but this time, the serving was huge, I couldn't finish and had to take home leftovers which they kindly boxed up for me.

Lastly, I love how the restaurant smells. Very pleasant and familiar but can't seem to put a finger on what it smells like. Will be back but with reinforcement to help eat.
Service is fine. Food is fine. The prices are aggressive for the dishes they are serving. I'd eat there over Ted's but Gezzo's just opened so I'd walk a few more steps if you like Mexican.
My first time at the Woodall was great! The service was excellent, the food was good, and the atmosphere even better. I had the tuna tartar and the steak frites. Delicious

I can't say enough great things about this restaurant. Excellent food and service! A must when visiting or frequent often if you are a regular. They even went above and beyond when I called to get a receipt from a few days prior.

My biggest complaint about The Woodall? The complaint towards myself for taking so long to finally visit here!

I kept telling myself I'd dine at this restaurant every time I drove by (and I drove by often). And tonight I made it happen! The entire dining experience was more than I could've expected--and I only dined on some of the smaller plates. I can't imagine how amazing the entrees are too!

The food was soooo good. And I quickly connected with the staff and would come back just to see them. I think I found my new neighborhood spot. Everything I tried was delicious, so they'd better get used to me visiting often.

owner_replies.comment:
Candyce,

We love to hear that your visit was more than you expected and that you'll be back! Thanks for the kind review of our restaurant, food and team. It is greatly appreciated and we look forward to having you back soon!

comment.text:
There is no possible way this place has more than two starts. FIRST .. we get there and the hostess has zero energy. No greeting. Just "give me your name so I can clock out" energy. Our waitress.. bless her heart.. it was clear that she was new. However.. WHERE WAS HER SUPPORT?!? We waited 30 mins for our drink that were basically water downed by the time they arrived. When I took them back to the bar... yes I took them to the bar .. the promptly remade the drinks but not before making sure the bartender was not blamed stating "the server left it there too long" smh. So our appetizer gets to the table. Green onions. After clearly stating an allergy
to onions. Ok. Next appetizer came out fine. Entree. Again onions. Brought out another order that I had to pick onions out of and finally just packed it to go to give away. Finally we're over it and decided to leave. You would think the hostess would say "thank you" or "goodnight" NOOOOPE! I had to say to her "you have a good night too" for her to pick up her head and realize she WASNT DOING HER JOB!!! Oh... did I mention this was an anniversary celebration. Yeah. I'm done.

The Woodall has been open just a few months. It's located to the front of Westside Village just off Marietta Blvd NW. 

The bartender Rob is great! He suggested I try Uncle Nearest, which I loved and he made me an amazing Old Fashioned - it was a little untraditional but really, really, really good. I don't advise it if you don't care for a sweeter drink there's a little banana liqueur in there...

For an appetizer I ordered the Calamari and Rock Shrimp - it was delicious! I was surprised to find slices of fried lemon, but that added to the appeal. 

If you're ordering to go definitely get the salmon dip!

For my meal I ordered the tenderloin open face sandwich. The meat well cooked to my preference (medium) and was delectable. I chose the fries as a side and let's just say Woodall owes me nothing!

Will I be back?

Definitely.

photos.caption: The bartop and my beer of choice High Life

owner_replies.comment:
Yaz,

Thanks for the review! It is greatly appreciated and we are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us. We can't wait to serve you again soon.

comment.text:
My husband and I were traveling through Atlanta on a Sunday and stumbled upon The Woodall. I checked out the reviews and the menu and after seeing "Lump Crab Beignets" this Maryland girl knew I had to give it a try. 
The restaurant is located in Westside Village at Moores Mill complex on Marietta Boulevard in a shopping center so there is plenty of parking.   We ordered our food to go online, the process was simple and the site was easy to navigate. Our food was ready within 25 minutes of placing the order. 

The staff was friendly when we picked up our order which was ready when we arrived. They offer outdoor seating and had a nice size bar with televisions.  

We ordered the Lump Crab Beignet Appetizer. Our Appetizer was very good, I didn't really taste Lump Crab meat but there was a nice Crab mixture in the middle of the fried dough. I definitely recommend and it is more than enough to share.  Both my husband and I ordered entrées of the Seared Trigger Fish. Our meals came with Basmati Fried Rice, Spinach, Lemongrass, with Hong Kong Sauce. My meal was delicious, everything was cooked perfectly and seasoned to perfection.  Another plus about The Woodall is that the prices are reasonable. 

I can't wait to come back to try the Butter Cake, the Beignets had way too many calories for me to try both in one visit.

owner_replies.comment:
Kai,

Thanks for taking the time to write us a kind and thoughtful review of our restaurant. We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your visit and we look forward to having you back when you're in town.

comment.text: Definitely a regular here. The servers are attentive and the food is really good. I tend to sit at the bar, and the bartenders always remember me which makes it more of a enjoyable experience. The cocktails are consistent and when things are "off" the managers take care of the customers. The Woodall burger is my go.... to try the kids Woodall if you don't want too big of a portion. Honestly... just about every dish I've tried is good.
Went for dinner last week and the service was exceptional! It's very nice and the food was all well seasoned and presented beautifully. I would love to return!

This was my second visit here. The first time I gave it a 4 star review because the chicken dish I had wasn't up to par.  This time, I give them a 5 star review!  

First, I had a cocktail called Bartender's choice.  You tell your server the types of cocktails you typically like and 
based off of what you tell them, the bartender creates a drink they think you will like.  I like Uncle Nearest whiskey.  I also like lemon drop martinis.  Using that knowledge, the bartender made a DELICIOUS  cocktail that contained Pineapple juice, orange juice,  lemon juice, simple syrup, a little allspice (ALLSPICE!!!) and a drizzle of cherry syrup on top.   HONEY- you talk about something good!?!  That drink was so good I had two!  Lol

We ordered the calamari and shrimp appetizer to soak up some of the alcohol.  My friend had the watermelon salad and loved it.  I'm not a melon person so I didn't taste it.   

For dinner, I had the trigger fish with basmati fried rice. It was good!  My friend had the snapper with French fries and green beans.  We both really enjoyed our meals.  

But the BEST part (other than my cocktail) was the dessert.  The butter cake is to die for.  My friend said it was orgasmic it was so good and they could use a cigarette after eating it.  Lol.  It is good - I wouldn't say quite that good but close.  Haha.

photos.caption: My "Bartender's choice" drink. I call it "Angie's Special"
Another view of the butter cake.
Snapper with green beans and French fries
Butter cake - OMG. This cake is so good you'll need a cigarette afterwards.  Haha
The top of my "Bartender's Choice" drink had a grenadine drizzle on it.
Trigger fish with basmati fried rice

owner_replies.comment:
A B.,

We are thrilled to hear that you and your guest enjoyed the visit! Thank you for giving us another shot and for the updated review. We greatly appreciate it and can't wait to have you back again. Thanks!

comment.text: Extremely delicious. The vibe and atmosphere is amazing. Went right at 4pm and the regulars were already coming in. Started with a lemon drop, absolutely excellent. Had the baby wedge salad with roasted pear and pecan, amazing. The Gorgonzola dressing? Delicious. My salmon entree with charred broccoli? Devine! My bartender was phenomenal and super chill. Made all my drinks to perfection. My new regular spot. I'm a Underwood Hills girl, but I'll be making my way 5 mins around the corner to upper westside.

Went on a Saturday night around 8:30pm. Impressed that there was no wait time. Party of 2 was immediately seated on the patio. Heating on the patio is impressive. It was very warm out. Servers was nice, however, service was slow. We received drinks after about 20 minutes. Food came out 45 minutes after being seated. Food was just ok. Drinks were just ok. It's one of those places you visit but will be ok if you never go back again. Hubby sent the Beef Carpaccio back. Steak was cooked perfectly, but food did not come out hot. Overall, just ok. Maybe we will try brunch, but no guarantee. Inside decor and atmosphere was beautiful.
What a great addition to the Upper Westside of Atlanta. Great food, drinks, atmosphere and service.

photos.caption: Wage beef pigs n a blanket

comment.text: The food, service and ambiance are all great! I've been a few times now for lunch and have enjoyed d their wine, apps and entrees. Recommend going with friends or as date night

Great appetizers and nice ambiance.  A good date night dinner spot or post-work/conference dinner with coworkers.  Definitely make a reservation in advance as they're usually busy and can't seat folks right away- even if a small party.  Their drinks are excellent as well.
Great atmosphere. Friendly staff. Top choice for drinks and an appetizer. After work or on the weekend, always a good stop.
Food was great, good atmosphere and great service.  Will definitely be going back soon.

This is one of my new favorite restaurants in Atlanta.  I just love this place. The decor, location, staff, and bar are amazing. I've been 10 times and they are solid - never had a bad experience, even when they've been understaffed. That's saying a lot these days. 

I recommend making reservations because sometimes they can get busy. They are pretty easy to secure so I always book ahead. My favorites appetizer is the calamari and rock shrimp appetizer. It's fried to perfection and served with marinara. I always ask for extra. For dinner, my go-to is the triggerfish.  It's a flaky white fish, pan seared  with a wonderful sauce drizzled on top served with fried rice and spinach. I have eaten the last grain of rice off the plate on many occasions - and I wasn't the least bit embarrassed. My husband normally gets the farfalle with shrimp. I'm surely not doing this dish justice. He gets it every time and scrapes his bowl clean. You see a theme here, right? 

One of the things I like most about the bar is the option to let the bartender surprise you. I've done this three times and it's like she knew me. They ask a few questions and get down to business. I haven't been disappointed yet. 

Lastly, the staff! These are hardworking people who love what they do. One of our servers knows our order and we don't have her every time. I really appreciate that attention to detail. 

This place is great for date night. Give it a try.

owner_replies.comment:
Kischa,

We are delighted by your thoughtful review! Thank you for sharing your experience with us and for being so loyal to us. We enjoy having you and your husband and look forward to seeing you soon.

comment.text:
This restaurant is a welcome addition to the area. It's beautiful inside and they have a great patio and bar. The patio is enclosed in the winter and open for the warmer months. 
I've been here a couple of times and the main take away is: the food is good, but service is slow. 
My last visit was with my hub, toddler, and 4 yo old. They do have a kids menu (everything $7.50) which is nice. I'm mad I forgot to take a pic. It has farfalle pasta with a choice or marinara, velveeta sauce, or butter (I think that's the last one); grilled or breaded chicken tenders with fries, burger with fries, or a petite filet steak with roasted veggies for an additional $4 or so. My kids had the pasta with marinara and it was very good, with big tomato chunks and garlic. 
For appetizers we had the pigs in a blanket, which we all enjoyed. For dinner, my husband had a full portion of the cacio e Pepe and I had an appetizer portion of farfalle stroganoff and the beets appetizer. 
The portions were weird because the cacio e Pepe seemed small for a full portion and the stroganoff seemed large for an appetizer portion; however, our bill was correct. The cacio e Pepe isn't you're typical version, this is gnocchi with lump crab, leeks, parm reggiano and other things. My hubby enjoyed and so did I. It was such as small portion so he had some of my pasta as well. The stroganoff was excellent and has short rib, Jerusalem artichoke, wild mushroom, other stuff and a dollop of creme fraiche. 
As stated earlier, we came do an earlier dinner so it wasn't too busy. While we were quickly seated and the server was nice, service was just too slow. After our initial water refill, it took a while for anyone to check on us. A runner who brought some Of our food out, left the appetizer plates on the table without bothering to ask if she could take them for us. When dining with young kids, less on the table is better. It took a while once we're finished eating for our server to come back. What I didn't like is that there were several other servers at the computer station near us who could clearly see me repeatedly looking for our server and no one asked if we needed help. I had to take the toddler to the car while hubs waited for the server because he was getting restless. And it still took 15 additional mins for my husband to wrap the bill up. I recall service being slow the previous time I visited as well. Overall, it's a nice restaurant with nice servers but it's be nice if they were more aware of people's time and if someone needs assistance even if it's not your table. At least let the server know that their table needs help. The food is good so I'll try them again, probably for brunch and hope that the service is more attentive.

photos.caption: Fries, expensive for the portion at $6
Tempura shrimp appetizer special. They said it was good for sharing, I don't know about that with only 2 shrimp and an arugula salad
Kids pasta with marinara, we took some out already for the toddler
Beet salad with salmon croquet bites. Hubby doesn't like beets but even he liked this
Farfalle stroganoff with short rib. Appetizer portion. Very good

comment.text: Some of the coolest staff we've met in Atlanta, the beverage/bar manager was awesome and so was the bartender. Fun fact: the head chef competed on Chopped! We didn't get to eat here, but the cocktails were super good. Will be back for food soon!

photos.caption: The matcha cocktail and the Paloma
A gin cocktail the bartender made for me that wasn't on the menu

comment.text: Absolutely phenomenal! Quite possibly the best pasta dish I've ever had. Kudos to the Chef for this unique combo to celebrate World Pasta Day! And the service by Jasmine was top knotch!!

photos.caption: Absolutely phenomenal! This was the best World Pasta Day dish. Kudos to the Chef... BBQd Octopus over cappelini.

owner_replies.comment:
Emily,

Thank you for being a regular with us! We enjoy having you and can't wait to have you back soon.

comment.text: I recently moved to the area and went to this location.  The food, service and ambiance was great.    I met a few people and they were very friendly.  I will definitely visit again.

My friends and I went for brunch last Saturday. We loved the cocktails, but the food was even better than expected! 

We had a reservation, as I thought it would
Be super busy, but I guess it hasn't caught on to the brunch crowd yet. 

I've also been for dinner and that was nice, but the brunch is the stand out for me!

owner_replies.comment:
Carla,

We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed brunch with us! Thanks for taking the time to write us a kind review and we look forward to having you back!

comment.text:
Probably the best fine dining restaurant I've ever been to! My new local favorite. 
The servers are so incredibly nice and make sure you are well taken care of. 
The kitchen knows quality and THEY DO IT BEST!!

After receiving horrible service across the street, my friend and I decided to try this gem of a restaurant. We were instantly greeted by the server/bartender Jessica, and her service is amazing! 

She recommended awesome drinks and appetizers and now she has a regular in me! (I had lump crab beignet with wasabi honey mustard and a hibiscus Paloma cocktail) 

I will be returning soon, and Jessica MUST be my server

owner_replies.comment:
Brandi,

Thanks for taking the time to write us the kind review! It is greatly appreciated and we will be sure to share it with Jess. We look forward to having you back!

comment.text: Great addition to the Upper Westside!!! The food is consistent and the staff is friendly.  This resto boast a dining room, a covered patio and a bar that opens to the alley way with additional seating and an outdoor fireplace. Talk about a vibe! RSVP encouraged. They get very busy. Free parking.

photos.caption: This pappardelle served with  summer squash, wild mushrooms, tomatoes, fava bean. I requested the addition of shrimp.

owner_replies.comment:
Nay,

We enjoyed serving you! Thanks for taking the time to leave us the great review. It is very much appreciated and we look forward to having you back.

comment.text: Everything was fantastic. Our server, Matt, guided us through an amazing experience - drinks, food, dessert. I don't have the words to describe how great he was. All of his recommendations were on point and we were all extremely happy. We will ask for him on our next visit. This was a. "Destination" visit, since we all live in Midtown and generally choose restaurants in and around that area. (One of us happened by The Woodall's website, and we decided to venture a little). Definitely worth the trip. The restaurant is gorgeous as well; the interior design is sophisticated and welcoming. Thanks so much, Matt!.

Excellent restaurant! Came here with my partner for Sunday brunch and had a great time here.

We tried a few of their signature cocktails and traditional mimosas and dirty martinis.

Eating healthier now and this place has excellent options to stay in check with the lifestyle change. We had the calamari, crab cakes, fried zucchini, and avocado toast.

Everything was excellent, however would skip on the calamari next time. It was fried heavily and pretty average.

Will definitely check out this spot again and it's in an excellent up and coming part of the city! Definitely check it out!

photos.caption: Fried zucchini, avocado toast, calamari. Excellent!

owner_replies.comment:
Maurice,

We enjoyed having you and your partner! Thanks for taking the time to leave us a kind review. We sure do appreciate it and we can't wait to have y'all back for more.

comment.text: Great local bistro in West Midtown where everything is elevated to another level. Open late for a drink or a bite after the game. Knowledgeable bar staff can offer suggestions to delight your drinking palate.

I have eaten at The Woodall twice now in one week and I will have to say I was impressed both times with the food and ambiance. The first time I sat on the patio and enjoyed the beautiful weather. The second time I sat on the inside close to the bar at one of the high tables. My server the second  time Bianca was the best. She had such great energy and was very attentive the entire evening. For my food I had the scallops the first time and the second time I had the open faced beef tenderloin sandwich with the most flavorful salad for my side. I will definitely be returning and sharing this restaurant with others.

photos.caption: Open face beef tenderloin with a side salad

owner_replies.comment:
Nakema,

Thanks for the kind review! It is greatly appreciated and we are thrilled to hear that both of your visits were great! We will share the review with Bianca and the team and we can't wait to see you again soon.

comment.text: I don't normally get better shoes, but I'm gonna give them one tonight I went there. The restaurant was virtually awesome. My sons brought me for my birthday. I had flowers and a card and the waitress never asked about the special occasion. She took quite a while to take our order, which was fine but when my son got his food, there were eggs in the fried rice, and he asked if you have some fried rice without eggs. The server's response was didn't I ask you about allergies? Wow! We were shocked and no she did not ask us about allergies. And no, he could not have fried rice without eggs. The manager explained that everything is premade and it would be too much trouble to make it without the eggs. She then brought our food and my fish and rice were sitting in a salty broth. This could've been rectified, but she never came back to the table until I finally eaten the fish but not the rice because it was sitting in liquid. I also observed there was no spinach in the fried rice, which it states on the menu is in the fried rice! when I pointed it out to her, she offered to bring me some spinach. Really? The manager took nine dollars off the check.  I called later on to let her know everything that had happened and she was patronizing and defensive. And made excuses for the server. Let's be clear if she's your best server you got a problem.
Just came here for the first time and it was great! Aly and Kim are amazing bartenders and the food was delicious. Highly recommend!
